intro: Toxanthes whitei, commonly known as the white toxanthes, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking white flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its botanical features include a slender stem and clustered inflorescences that bloom during the wet season. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
